greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of sum of reciprocals of primorial numbers: 1/2 + 1/6 + 1/30 + 1/210 + ... = 0.7052301717918009651474316828882485137435776391...
comment: This is the real number whose Engel expansion is precisely the sequence of primes A000040. - _Jonathan Vos Post_, May 04 2005

Let S be the operator over the space omega of infinite sequences of numbers, defined to be the Engel expansion of the sum of reciprocals of primorials of a sequence p of numbers; than the eigenvalue-equation S p = p is satisfied by the sequence of prime numbers. - _Ralf Steiner_, Dec 31 2016
This constant is irrational (Griffiths, 2015). - _Amiram Eldar_, Oct 27 2020
reference: Friedrich Engel, "Entwicklung der Zahlen nach Stammbruechen" Verhandlungen der 52. Versammlung deutscher Philologen und Schulmaenner in Marburg. pp. 190-191, 1913.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000

Friedrich Engel, Entwicklung der Zahlen nach Stammbruechen, Verhandlungen der 52. Versammlung deutscher Philologen und Schulmaenner in Marburg, 1913, pp. 190-191. English translation by Georg Fischer, included with his permission.
Martin Griffiths, <a href="https://doi.org/10.1017/mag.2015.91">99.29 On the sum of the reciprocals of the primorials>/a>, The Mathematical Gazette, Vol. 99, No. 546 (2015), pp. 522-523.
Simon Plouffe, Sum of the product of prime reciprocals.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Engel Expansion.
maple: for n from 1 to q do  a:=a*ithprime(n); b:=b+1/a; od; print(evalf(b,100));
mathematica: RealDigits[ Sum[1/Product[ Prime[i], {i, n}], {n, 58}], 10, 111][[1]] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 05 2005 *)
program: (PARI) default(realprecision, 20080); p=1; s=x=0; for (k=1, 10^9, p*=prime(k); s+=1.0/p; if (s==x, break); x=s ); x*=10; for (n=0, 20000, d=floor(x); x=(x-d)*10; write("b064648.txt", n, " ", d)) \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Sep 21 2009
N(pv(100),digits=108) # From Maple code _Jani Melik_, Jul 22 2015
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Oct 04 2001
